case_vignette: A 50-year-old farmer from Jamaica presents to his physician with a wart-like lesion on his left foot. He is a plantain farmer and often farms barefoot because of the pleasant climate. Physical examination reveals warty, cutaneous nodules that resemble the florets of cauliflower. On a KOH preparation, irregular, dark brown, yeast-like bodies with septae are noted. Culture on Sabouraud agar reveals sclerotic bodies.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have this wart-like bump on my left foot.
How long has the wart-like bump been there?
I'm not exactly sure when it started.
Is the bump painful or itchy?
No, it's not painful or itchy.
Have you noticed any changes in size, color, or shape since you first saw the bump?
Yes, it seems to have grown and now it kind of looks like a cauliflower.
Do you have similar bumps anywhere else on your body?
No, just the one on my foot.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin cancer?
No, I don't have any history of skin cancer.
Have you recently been walking barefoot in public areas like locker rooms or around swimming pools?
No, I just walk barefoot on my farm.
Do you have diabetes, peripheral vascular disease, or any other conditions that affect your feet or circulation?
No, I don't have any of those conditions.
Have you tried any treatments or remedies for this bump so far?
No, I haven't tried any treatments yet.
Final Diagnosis: Plantar wart
